meanings.definition: To express or portray emotions excessively or melodramatically.
meanings.sent1: She overemoted during the school play, making the audience laugh.
meanings.sent2: He always overemoted in his acting, which made his performances memorable.
meanings.sent3: The actor overemoted so much that even the props seemed surprised.
meanings.sent4: Her overemoted expressions painted a vivid picture of the character's inner turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The singer overemoted the lyrics, bringing the song to life.

meanings.definition: Having displayed emotions in an exaggerated or excessive manner.
meanings.sent1: The overemoted actress received mixed reviews for her performance.
meanings.sent2: He was known for his overemoted reactions to even the smallest things.
meanings.sent3: The overemoted puppy wagged its tail wildly at the sight of a treat.
meanings.sent4: Her overemoted gestures added a touch of drama to the mundane scene.
meanings.sent5: The overemoted expression on his face was hard to miss.
